name: NPR
text:
Florida has issued a directive requiring all school districts to offer in-person instruction. 

But as COVID-19 cases surge in the state, many educators are questioning the push to reopen schools next month. https://t.co/1lXXu4QFOA

name: NPR
text:
Indonesia now has more than 80,000 confirmed coronavirus cases, with more than 3,200 dead. Epidemiologists say it's due to government failures, including misinformation.

"I don't think Indonesia has the means to stop the disease now," one scientist says.
https://t.co/ZPAED77O95

name: NPR
text:
The NSA says Russian hackers are attempting to break into organizations working on a potential coronavirus vaccine. The agency believes they're part of the group blamed for hacking Democratic Party emails in 2016.
 https://t.co/ifUFQHMxgJ

name: NPR
text:
The Republican party has announced it will scale back its August convention in Florida.

Attendance for the first few days will be limited to RNC delegates, which is a little more than 2,500 people. The final day is expected to total about 7,000. https://t.co/9XPvSwlwii

name: NPR
text:
The Asheville City Council has approved a reparations resolution for Black residents and formally apologized for the local government's historic role in slavery and racist and discriminatory policies.
https://t.co/C2hFNAycTe

name: NPR
text:
In 2013, the GOP produced a report laying out how the party should move forward â€” including expanding outreach to people of color, women and young voters.

Today, it's a window into the pressures that some fear will hurt the party for generations to come.
https://t.co/jRvwI6HecK

name: NPR
text:
Capt. Tom Moore will soon become Capt. Sir Tom Moore.

The 100-year-old WWII veteran will be knighted by Queen Elizabeth II on Friday after he raised more than $40 million for health care workers by walking laps in his garden.
https://t.co/rWN0JAq1aH

name: NPR
text:
The mayor of New Bedford, Mass., issued emergency orders with a set of enforceable guidelines to protect essential workers during the pandemic. Safety experts say it could be a model for cities across the country.
https://t.co/hIIA9QTlVH
